tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in German.
Used primarily in written German and formal speech to describe completed actions in the past. Also used in storytelling and narratives.
Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'morgen' (tomorrow) or 'nächste Woche' (next week).
Used to express actions that will be completed by a certain point in the future. Often used with time expressions like 'bis morgen' (by tomorrow) or to make assumptions about past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis nächste Woche werde ich dort gewesen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By next week, I will have been there

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du wirst sicher sehr müde gewesen sein nach der langen Reise
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will surely have been very tired after the long journey

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie wird wahrscheinlich zu Hause gewesen sein, als ich anrief
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She will probably have been at home when I called

conjugations.exampleSentence: In zwei Jahren werden wir verheiratet gewesen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: In two years, we will have been married

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr werdet mit der Arbeit fertig gewesen sein, bevor der Chef kommt
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have been finished with the work before the boss arrives

conjugations.exampleSentence: Bis Ende des Monats werden sie in drei Ländern gewesen sein
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: By the end of the month, they will have been to three countries

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken German.
Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Als ich ankam, war ich schon einmal dort gewesen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: When I arrived, I had already been there before

conjugations.exampleSentence: Du warst vor der Prüfung sehr nervös gewesen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been very nervous before the exam

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie war lange Zeit Lehrerin gewesen, bevor sie Direktorin wurde
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She had been a teacher for a long time before she became principal

conjugations.exampleSentence: Wir waren im Museum gewesen, bevor wir ins Café gingen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had been to the museum before we went to the café

conjugations.exampleSentence: Ihr wart die ganze Nacht wach gewesen
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had been awake all night

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sie waren gute Freunde gewesen, bis der Streit sie trennte
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had been good friends until the argument separated them

tenses.description: Used primarily in indirect speech and formal writing to report what someone else has said. Also used in certain fixed expressions and formal contexts.
Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'wenn' (if) clauses.
Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (du, ihr) and formal address (Sie). The subject pronoun is usually omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Please be on time for the meeting!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Seid vorsichtig, wenn ihr über die Straße geht!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be careful when you cross the street!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Seien Sie so freundlich und helfen Sie mir!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Be so kind and help me!
